post.body:
How do you get tor Always working?
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1565403304_1D9oYXWZH2S55PeoCFDKTqq8roNXqZqP7n/How+do+you+get+tor+Always+working
Best way to answer a ZN question is with a ZN link .

Looking into maybe creating [CrazyID](/1PbBfQYf3XFFasNb8Py639qxMsGmuqE3WF).  

@Kaffie: does it require namecoin, which I saw you are disappointed in?

### Considering creating an Angular Site 
follow-up [in ZT](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1565764347_1D9oYXWZH2S55PeoCFDKTqq8roNXqZqP7n/Anyone+try+building+an+Angular+site+here)
Never had time to try publishing an Angular site in ZN today.
If you remove the "http://127.0.0.1" part of link and just use relative, your link with work with relays.

Trying to create [an Angular site](/1Gtzk5w72SmSx7GW6Y1JaGLgPfkXH2Wanz). 
 [Details are here](/1KmgpXc9BLFxw1ccGANYVzvDh3YG95tSe3/?Topic:1565993644_1D9oYXWZH2S55PeoCFDKTqq8roNXqZqP7n/Testing+a+static+Angular+site+in+ZeroNet)

Running in an IFrame, a requirement of ZN, introduces issues.
Wondering if @nofish is still involved with this project, or on a sabbatical.
Censorship attacks are very easy today.  They can just have bots post socially negative chatter.  Have the press report on it. You know the rest.

[ZN Angular 8 demo](/1Gtzk5w72SmSx7GW6Y1JaGLgPfkXH2Wanz) is up and running!
 
 [Details are here](/1KmgpXc9BLFxw1ccGANYVzvDh3YG95tSe3/?Topic:1565993644_1D9oYXWZH2S55PeoCFDKTqq8roNXqZqP7n/Testing+a+static+Angular+site+in+ZeroNet)
Reviewed the ZN code to [begin discussing the NOSANDBOX permission](/1KmgpXc9BLFxw1ccGANYVzvDh3YG95tSe3/?Topic:1566178696_1D9oYXWZH2S55PeoCFDKTqq8roNXqZqP7n/Using+the+NOSANDBOX+permission).
Today I put ZeroFrame under a microscope.
Sigh... got through [client side of ZeroFrame code](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1NtQvrYd8rJzQYP3j1snmi28mPn8wSXX4X/?Page:zeronet-design).  Server-side next.

comment.body:
@Kaffie: Have you tried playing with the "base href" tag for that, commonly used by apps such as [Angular](https://shekhargulati.com/2017/07/06/angular-4-use-of-base-href-and-deploy-url-build-options/).  Accessing the same site via multiple URL depths is a challenge, and "base href" is the only way I know to work around it.  You may need some JS with that to get it to work 100% of the time, where the base href is calculated using browser URL. 

What plug-in/tool are you using for .bit DNS browser host resolution?
@SSDifnskdjfnsdjk: CORS issues right now I'm looking at.  This is a test to identify the challenges in deploying a static Angular site in ZN.  And, it's doing a great job of identifying them.  lol

@Kaffie: You would of been happy in the 80s.  Productivity determines capability.  You want this place to blossom, need to think bigger.  @SSDifnskdjfnsdjk is using over 20x as much space in ZeroTalk with just his chats lol

> @anshorei: 
Can you try again?  I was playing with it.  The 2nd one is resolved by the NOSANDBOX permission you need to accept.  Don't worry.  Just a static demo site.  
Just tested and works in Brave, FF, Chrome, FF Private, Tor Br.  

The reason for the NOSANDBOX requirement [is documented here](/1KmgpXc9BLFxw1ccGANYVzvDh3YG95tSe3/?Topic:1565995454_1D9oYXWZH2S55PeoCFDKTqq8roNXqZqP7n/ISSUE+CORS+prevents+site+from+loading#comment_11_1D9oYXWZH2S55PeoCFDKTqq8roNXqZqP7n). All Angular sites will need it.

@Styromaniac: for mobile?  would this work?

```width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0```
@Styromaniac: added it.  did it solve anything for you?
@Styromaniac: Just compromised and changed to 0.9.  I can't tell a diff when I refresh.
@Styromaniac: I publish every change right away. Dunno why it is taking long to get to you.

> @gitcenter: "Using NOSANDBOX is always a bad idea..."

I [replied to your concerns here](/1KmgpXc9BLFxw1ccGANYVzvDh3YG95tSe3/?Topic:1565995454_1D9oYXWZH2S55PeoCFDKTqq8roNXqZqP7n/ISSUE+CORS+prevents+site+from+loading+RESOLVED#comment_13_1D9oYXWZH2S55PeoCFDKTqq8roNXqZqP7n).
